instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermitent power
threads.message:
only can  turn on when reconnect the battery. once u shutdown cant turn on again the charging indicator turns green 
and then orange once u press power button. tried change battery still same
board is clean no sign of corossion
run diagnostics no issues found.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  8.6V

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermitent power
threads.message:
Remove battery and get it working properly with charger first.
Once charger is connected, Magsafe light MUST switch from green to amber; before pressing power button.
If not, try another LIO board/flex, as first stept.
Confirm if you are in this case.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermitent power
threads.message:
same issue with or without battery replaced LIO board/flex,
can on but once u shut it down cant turn on again.
after trying to turn again after pressing power button from orange light it will turn to greenlight for 1sec then orange again 
no fan spin no chime you must to reconnect the battery again if battery removed u must to reconnect the charger. 
anyway, once u turn on 1stime after battery reconnection everything is normal and working fine. 
no idea what to check from here.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermitent power
threads.message:
If LED flashes pressing power button, seems that SMC reset is done instead.
Disconnect keyboard and use <RESISTOR>R5116</RESISTOR> pads tu control power.

Post <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> voltages, w/ and w/o keyboard connected.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> intermitent power
threads.message: solved this issue found corroded from trackpad connector. thanks
